Class BodyHistory

java.lang.Object
us.stomberg.solarsystemsim.physics.BodyHistory
public class BodyHistory extends Object
The BodyHistory class provides a mechanism for tracking the position, velocity, and acceleration history of a physics body over a fixed number of time steps.

This class implements an efficient circular buffer that maintains historical state information, enabling calculations such as linear velocity based on position changes over time. It is particularly useful for simulation stability and analysis.

The history storage is pre-allocated with reusable state objects to minimize garbage collection overhead during simulation.

  • Field Details

    • historyLength

      public static final int historyLength
      The maximum number of historical states to maintain in the buffer.

      This defines the size of the circular buffer used for history tracking.

      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • BodyHistory

      public BodyHistory(Vector3D position, Vector3D velocity)
      Creates a new history tracker for a body with the given position and velocity.

      Initializes the history buffer with empty states that will be populated as the simulation progresses.

      Parameters:
      position - The initial position vector of the body
      velocity - The initial velocity vector of the body

  • Method Details

    • getPosition

      public Vector3D getPosition()
      Gets the current position vector of the body.

      This returns a reference to the internal position vector, not a copy.

      Returns:
      The current position vector

    • getVelocity

      public Vector3D getVelocity()
      Gets the current velocity vector of the body.

      This returns a reference to the internal velocity vector, not a copy.

      Returns:
      The current velocity vector

    • findLinearVelocity

      public Vector3D findLinearVelocity(TimeStep step)
      Calculates the linear velocity based on position change over time.

      This method computes the velocity by finding the difference between the current position and the position from the most recent history entry, then dividing by the remaining time in the step. If no history is available, it returns a copy of the current velocity.

      This calculation is useful for stable velocity estimates in numerical simulations.

      Parameters:
      step - The time step containing timing information
      Returns:
      A vector representing the calculated linear velocity

    • getHistory

      public BodyHistory.State getHistory()
      Gets the most recent historical state.

      This method returns the state at the current head position in the circular buffer, or null if no historical states have been recorded yet.

      Returns:
      The most recent historical state, or null if none exists

    • getHistory

      public BodyHistory.State getHistory(int steps)
      Gets a historical state from a specified number of steps in the past.

      Retrieves a state from the circular buffer at the specified number of steps before the current head position. If the requested state is outside the buffer boundaries, returns null.

      Parameters:
      steps - Number of steps back in history to retrieve (0 is most-recent)
      Returns:
      The historical state at the specified position, or null if invalid

    • updateHistory

      public void updateHistory(Vector3D acceleration)
      Records the current state in the history buffer.

      This method updates the circular buffer with the current position, velocity, and the provided acceleration. It reuses existing State objects to avoid creating unnecessary objects during the simulation.

      The history buffer maintains up to historyLength states, with older states being overwritten as new ones are added.

      Parameters:
      acceleration - The current acceleration vector to store with this state
